Components

Browse our complete list of original components. They’re built mobile first and are responsive out of the box, so view them at different screen sizes for a complete picture.

This component adds 15KB to your CSS file as the SVGs are embedded in CSS. We’re moving away from this in favor of separate SVGs. This will reduce the CSS filesize.
Note: Using @wk-brand,@wk-brand-small,@wk-logo, and@wk-make-logomixins still work, but they are being deprecated. Please refer to the relevant sassdoc section for more information.

Favicons

When combined, they support legacy IE, Android, iOS, and modern desktop browsers. The sizes include 16x16, 32x32, 64x64, and 192x192 pixels.

For best results, copy and paste the following code into the HTML <head>.

<!--[if IE]><link rel="shortcut icon" href="https://cdn.wolterskluwer.io/wk-css/0.16.x/assets/images/favicon/favicon.ico"><![endif]-->
<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" href="https://cdn.wolterskluwer.io/wk-css/0.16.x/assets/images/favicon/apple-touch-icon.png"/>
<link rel="icon" href="https://cdn.wolterskluwer.io/wk-css/0.16.x/assets/images/favicon/favicon.png"/>

▲ Back to top

Colors

Primary colors

The colors of our logo are our primary colors: Wolters Kluwer Red, Wolters Kluwer Green, Wolters Kluwer Blue, Wolters Kluwer Gray. They are the building blocks of the brand identity and comprise the core color palette. They make the brand unique and identifiable.

To build Brand recognition, at least one of the primary Wolters Kluwer colors must be used on all material.

#e5202e

wkRed

#007ac3

wkBlue

#85bc20

wkGreen

#474747

wkGray

#000000

wkBlack

#ffffff

wkWhite

Secondary colors

The secondary color palette provides a range of supporting colors. Each of the secondary colors is chosen to be compatible with the Wolters Kluwer’s primary colors. The primary and secondary colors should be used in combination to provide unique communications that will reinforce our Brand.

Secondary colors should be used as highlights to attract attention, express an approachable, high-energy personality, and enhance or complement imagery in all communication pieces.

#009881

wkGreen

#ea8f00

wkOrange

#940c72

wkPurple

#241866

wkBlue

Tints and Shades

All colors may be used in 75% (tint1), 50% (tint2) and 35% (tint3) tints in combination with the 100% (base) color. This way the tints work as layers, especially when used with transparency.

Gray can be used in more tints to create even more layers, especially for online use.

Primary Tints and Shades

Brand colors usage

There's a handy SCSS function you can use to retrieve the exact colors from the brand:

.some-custom-box {
    // this will retrieve primary green color
    background-color: wk-primary-color('wkGreen');
}

.fancy-box {
    // this will retrieve secondary blue tint 1 color
    background-color: wk-secondary-color('wkBlue', 'tint1');
}

Typography

The type component is fundamental to your project’s look and feel. It provides font sizes, families, and the web fonts themselves.

Primary Font

Fira Sans is the brand-compliant, primary font for Wolters Kluwer.

Fira Sans Sample

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

Complementary Font

Franziska Italic is the brand-compliant, complementary font for Wolters Kluwer.

Franziska Italic Sample

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

Special-use Fonts

The following special-use fonts are permitted for use within Wolters Kluwer product development efforts.

Franziska

Franziska Sample

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

DejaVu Sans Mono

DejaVu Sans Mono Sample

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

Usage Example

Both special-use fonts Franziska and DejaVu Sans Mono are used within the Document component. Franziska, a serif font suited for long text, improves the reading experience for the user. DejaVu Sans Mono, a monospaced font, allows sections of the Document containing preformatted text to render correctly.

Brand Portal

Please visit the Wolters Kluwer Brand Portal for additional information about brand compliant use of fonts in your project.

Type Component Styles

Type has been arranged for ease of implementation and balanced for legibility. Use base elements or apply the relevant wk classes.

Effective areas include:

  • Headings: <h1>, <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, <h5>, <h6>
  • Alternate heading styles
  • Base elements like <p>, <li>, <blockquote>, <pre>, <code>, and <a>.
  • Convenient font-stack variables so you don’t have to supply font-family CSS rules.
  • Monospace, providing DejaVu Sans Mono in a Regular style
See full page example

▲ Back to top

Accessibility

Enhance the contrast of the :focus state in your application by adding a body class. 

<body class="wk-a11y-enhanced-focus"></body>
See full page example

▲ Back to top

Layout

Not a grid — we prefer to call them layouts.

They’re fluid, built mobile first, and are responsive. These layouts are based on 12 columns by default, but of course they’re totally configurable.

Each layout is available in two variations, stacking and persistent. Stacking layouts transform to one column in mobile whereas persistent layouts maintain separate columns on all views.

Layout Breakpoints

The following breakpoints are used throughout WK CSS, but are critical in the operation of this component.

mobile
up to 37.5rem (600px)
tablet
between 37.5rem (600px) and 65rem (1040px) .
desktop
65rem (1040px) and up.
max desktop
nothing within a container will be wider than 75rem (1200px)
See full page example

Column Layouts

The following are 2, 3, and 4 responsive column patterns that are available for immediate use, but as always, you can build your own!

The layouts are named for their percentage widths and are available as classes and mixins. This way you can use model your markup semantically.

1/4
3/4
1/3
2/3
1/2
1/2
2/3
1/3
3/4
1/4
1/3
1/3
1/3
1/4
1/4
1/4
1/4
<!-- these stack in mobile -->
<div class="wk-layout-25-75">
  <div class="wk-layout-item"><span>1/4</span></div>
  <div class="wk-layout-item"><span>3/4</span></div>
</div>
<div class="wk-layout-33-66">
  <div class="wk-layout-item"><span>1/3</span></div>
  <div class="wk-layout-item"><span>2/3</span></div>
</div>

  <div class="wk-layout-item"><span>1/2</span></div>
  <div class="wk-layout-item"><span>1/2</span></div>
</div>

  <div class="wk-layout-item"><span>2/3</span></div>
  <div class="wk-layout-item"><span>1/3</span></div>
</div>

See full page example

Centered Layouts

Centered layouts are useful for aligning content in the center of a page. They are useful for <form> elements, modals, and any standard body of text.

Small

The small layout is 100% wide on moble screens, but on larger screens it assumes a narrower view than the minimum tablet size.

small

Medium

The medium layout has a consistent width on tablet and desktop sizes.

medium

Large

The large layout transforms to the size of the medium layout when the viewport limits the width.

large
Note: on this page the centered layouts are not to scale. See the full page example.
<div class="wk-layout-centered-small"><span>small</span></div>
<div class="wk-layout-centered-medium"><span>medium</span></div>
<div class="wk-layout-centered-large"><span>large</span></div>
See full page example

▲ Back to top

Grid

The grid component is great for fast prototyping or a quick proof of concept

Simply fill a .wk-row with .wk-col items. Remember the sum must always be 12.

<div class="wk-row">
  <div class="wk-col-4"></div>
  <div class="wk-col-4"></div>
  <div class="wk-col-4"></div>
</div>
<div class="wk-row">
  <div class="wk-col-3"></div>
  <div class="wk-col-3"></div>
  <div class="wk-col-3"></div>
  <div class="wk-col-3"></div>
</div>
See full page example

▲ Back to top

Header

The header component provides a structurally sound display of the Wolters Kluwer brand along with space for navigational elements.

Optionally fix the header to the top of the screen by adding the .wk-fixed-top class at the topmost level.

In its simplest form, the header has only the responsive logo. Add in the Nav component for a responsive navigation area.

Logo

Logo Nav New Design

Note: The new design includes green icons. Green icons will eventually become the default style, but start using them now by using the wk-green-icons class. See the code sample below.

  • More
  • Tools
  • Help
  • Account

Logo Nav Old Design

Note: The gray icons are still default, but to keep them gray in the future, just add the wk-gray-icons class. See the code sample below.

  • More
  • Tools
  • Help
  • Account

Logo Nav Small Screen

  • More
  • Tools
  • Help
  • Account

Logo Nav Small Screen Menu Open

  • More
  • Tools
  • Help
  • Account
<!-- header with logo only -->
<header role="banner" class="wk-header">
  <div class="wk-header-container"><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="wk-logo"><img src="assets/brand/wk-brand-small.svg" alt="Wolters Kluwer Product Name - Page anchor links to" class="wk-logo-small"/><img src="assets/brand/wk-brand.svg" alt="Wolters Kluwer Product Name - Page anchor links to" class="wk-logo-large"/></a></div>
</header>
<!-- header with logo and nav (new design, green icons) -->
<header role="banner" class="wk-header">
  <div class="wk-header-container"><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="wk-logo"><img src="assets/brand/wk-brand-small.svg" alt="Wolters Kluwer Product Name - Page anchor links to" class="wk-logo-small"/><img src="assets/brand/wk-brand.svg" alt="Wolters Kluwer Product Name - Page anchor links to" class="wk-logo-large"/></a>
    <ul class="wk-more-menu wk-green-icons">
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span class="wk-icon-more"></span>More</a></li>
    </ul>
    <ul class="wk-nav wk-green-icons">
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span class="wk-icon-wrench"></span>Tools</a></li>
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span class="wk-icon-help-outline"></span>Help</a></li>
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span class="wk-icon-contact-outline"></span>Account</a></li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</header>
<!-- header with logo and nav (old design, gray icons) -->
<header role="banner" class="wk-header">
  <div class="wk-header-container"><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="wk-logo"><img src="assets/brand/wk-brand-small.svg" alt="Wolters Kluwer Product Name - Page anchor links to" class="wk-logo-small"/><img src="assets/brand/wk-brand.svg" alt="Wolters Kluwer Product Name - Page anchor links to" class="wk-logo-large"/></a>

<header role="banner" class="wk-header">
  <div class="wk-header-container"><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="wk-logo"><img src="assets/brand/wk-brand-small.svg" alt="Wolters Kluwer Product Name - Page anchor links to" class="wk-logo-small"/><img src="assets/brand/wk-brand.svg" alt="Wolters Kluwer Product Name - Page anchor links to" class="wk-logo-large"/></a>
    <!-- add the .open class to .wk-more-menu -->
    <ul class="wk-more-menu open">
      <li>...</li>
    </ul>
    <!-- add the .open class to .wk-nav too -->
    <ul class="wk-nav open">
      <li>...</li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</header>

Nav

The Nav component can be used on its own, but it is often used within the Header component or Navbar component.

The component uses the .wk-nav class at the root and comes with shared states. Swap modifier classes to utilize different styles.

Default

  • Home
  • Profile
  • Messages
  • Reports

With Icons

  • Home
  • Profile
  • Messages
  • Reports

Stacked

  • Home
  • Profile
  • Messages
  • Reports

Tabbed

Did you include Modernizr and IE conditional statements? This component requires them!
  • Home
  • Section A
  • Section B
  • Section C
  • Section D
  • Section E
  • Section F
  • Section G
<ul class="wk-nav">
  <li><a href="javascript:void(0)">Home</a></li>
  <li><a href="javascript:void(0)">Profile</a></li>
  <li><a href="javascript:void(0)">Messages</a></li>
  <li><a href="javascript:void(0)">Reports</a></li>
</ul>
<ul class="wk-nav">
  <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="wk-icon-home-outline">Home</a></li>
  <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="wk-icon-contact-outline">Profile</a></li>
  <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="wk-icon-chatboxes-outline">Messages</a></li>
  <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="wk-icon-paper-outline">Reports</a></li>
</ul>
<ul class="wk-nav wk-nav-stacked">
  <li><a href="javascript:void(0)">Home</a></li>
  <li><a href="javascript:void(0)">Profile</a></li>
  <li><a href="javascript:void(0)">Messages</a></li>
  <li><a href="javascript:void(0)">Reports</a></li>
</ul>
<div class="wk-nav-tab-bar">
  <div class="wk-tab-bar-container">
    <div class="wk-tab-bar-gradient">
      <div class="wk-tab-bar-gradient-before"></div>
      <ul role="tablist" class="wk-nav wk-nav-tabs">
        <li role="tab"><a tabIndex="0">Home</a></li>
        <li role="tab" aria-selected="true" class="active"><a tabIndex="0">Section A</a></li>
        <li role="tab"><a tabIndex="0">Section B</a></li>
        <li role="tab"><a tabIndex="0">Section C</a></li>
        <li role="tab"><a tabIndex="0">Section D</a></li>
        <li role="tab"><a tabIndex="0">Section E</a></li>
        <li role="tab"><a tabIndex="0">Section F</a></li>
        <li role="tab"><a tabIndex="0">Section G</a></li>
      </ul>
      <div class="wk-tab-bar-gradient-after"></div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
See full page tabs example

▲ Back to top

Product Name

Product Name can be used as a standalone component but is more often used in conjunction with the Navbar component for displaying the product brand.

The background colors span the full width of the viewable area and contain the proper responsive padding so the content doesn’t touch the edges.

Standalone

Sample Product Name

Within Navbar

Sample Product Name
<div class="wk-product-name-bar">
  <div class="wk-product-name">Sample  <em>Product Name</em></div>
</div>
<nav role="navigation" class="wk-navbar">
  <div class="wk-navbar-container">
    <div class="wk-product-name">Sample  <em>Product Name</em></div>
  </div>
</nav>

▲ Back to top

Navbar

The Navbar is essentially a blue bar that reaches the extreme edges of the viewable window to provide a bed for the Nav component and possibly the Product Name component.

Default

  • Menu
  • Home
  • Profile
  • Messages
  • Reports

With Product Name

  • Menu
  • Home
  • Profile
  • Messages
  • Reports
Sample Product Name

With Product Name (Mobile)

  • Menu
  • Home
  • Profile
  • Messages
  • Reports
Sample Product Name

With Product Name (Mobile Menu Open)

  • Menu
  • Home
  • Profile
  • Messages
  • Reports
Sample Product Name

With Breadcrumbs

  1. Home
  2. Code Sections
  3. Income Taxes

Fixed top

Add the .wk-fixed-top class to maintain the Navbar’s position while scrolling.

<!-- default -->
<nav role="navigation" class="wk-navbar">
  <div class="wk-navbar-container">
    <ul class="wk-more-menu">
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span class="wk-icon-menu"></span>Menu</a></li>
    </ul>
    <ul class="wk-nav">
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)">Home</a></li>
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)">Profile</a></li>
      <li role="presentation" class="active"><a href="javascript:void(0)">Messages</a></li>
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)">Reports</a></li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</nav>
<!-- with product name -->
<nav role="navigation" class="wk-navbar">
  <div class="wk-navbar-container">
    <ul class="wk-more-menu">
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span class="wk-icon-menu"></span>Menu</a></li>
    </ul>
    <ul class="wk-nav">
      <li role="presentation" class="active"><a href="javascript:void(0)">Home</a></li>
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)">Profile</a></li>
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)">Messages</a></li>
      <li role="presentation"><a href="javascript:void(0)">Reports</a></li>
    </ul>
    <div class="wk-product-name">Sample  <em>Product Name</em></div>
  </div>
</nav>
<!-- toggle the .open class to reveal the menu -->
<nav role="navigation" class="wk-navbar">
  <div class="wk-navbar-container">
    <!-- add the .open class to .wk-more-menu -->
    <ul class="wk-more-menu open">
      <li>...</li>
    </ul>
    <!-- add the .open class to .wk-nav too -->
    <ul class="wk-nav open">
      <li>...</li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</nav>
<!-- navbar-->
<nav role="navigation" class="wk-navbar">
  <div class="wk-navbar-container">
    <ol class="wk-breadcrumb">
      <li><a href="/"><span class="wk-icon-home-outline">Home</span></a></li>
      <li><a href="/"><span>Code Sections</span></a></li>
      <li><span>Income Taxes</span></li>
    </ol>
  </div>
</nav>
<!-- fix the navbar to the top -->
<nav role="navigation" class="wk-navbar wk-fixed-top">
  <div class="wk-navbar-container">
    <div class="wk-navbar-list">
      <ol class="wk-breadcrumb">
        <li><a href="/"><span class="wk-icon-home">Home</span></a></li>
        <li><span>Search</span></li>
      </ol>
    </div>
  </div>
</nav>
See default versionSee product name versionSee the fixed-top version

Search

Did you include Modernizr and IE conditional statements? This component requires them!

Search Input

Primary

Primary + Integrated Select Box

Within Search Bar

<form class="wk-search">
  <button type="button" class="wk-search-submit"><span class="wk-icon-search"></span><span class="wk-search-button-text">Search</span></button>
  <div class="wk-search-container">
    <input type="search" placeholder="Search by Keyword, Topic, or Citation" class="wk-search-input"/>
  </div>
</form>
<form class="wk-search">
  <div class="wk-select-field">
    <select>
      <option>...</option>
    </select>
  </div>
  <div class="wk-search-box">
    <input type="search" placeholder="..." class="wk-search-input"/>
    <button type="button" class="wk-search-submit wk-icon-search"></button>
  </div>
</form>
<form class="wk-search index-last-search-input">
  <div class="wk-select-field">
    <select>
      <option>...</option>
    </select>
  </div>
  <div class="wk-search-box">
    <button type="button" class="wk-search-submit"><span class="wk-icon-search"></span><span class="wk-search-button-text">Search</span></button>
    <div class="wk-search-container">
      <input type="search" placeholder="Search by Keyword, Topic, or Citation" class="wk-search-input"/>
    </div>
  </div>
</form>
<!-- light gray bar - suitably placed beneath the header -->
<div class="wk-search-bar">
  <!-- search component here -->
</div>
See full page example

</form>
<form class="wk-search">
  <!-- search input goes here -->
  <ul class="wk-list">
    <li>Result 1</li>
    <li>Result 2</li>
    <li>Result 3</li>
  </ul>
</form>

Cards

Did you include Modernizr and IE conditional statements? This component requires them!

Useful for displaying content previews, cards come with responsive layouts so you don’t have to position them.

Here we have a layout where 3 cards are adjacent on desktops but then changes to 2 on tablet.

All card layout variations are 100% wide on mobile.

Aliqua anim

Qui esse velit eiusmod

Fugiat aute est exercitation sunt

Nulla laborum

Cillum cillum ipsum excepteur

Cillum enim culpa non id

Anim sit

Do minim ullamco do

Nostrud adipisicing velit aliqua cupidatat 

<!-- 3 adjacent cards no desktop, 2 adjacent on tablet, 1 column stacked on mobile -->
<div class="wk-card-group wk-card-group-3">
  <div tabIndex="0" class="wk-card"><span class="wk-card-meta">Nisi duis </span>
    <h4 class="wk-card-title">Pariatur id sit deserunt 
    </h4>
    <p>Minim occaecat non Lorem sint 
    </p>
  </div>
  <!-- as many .wk-card's as you wish -->
  <!-- no need to put them in rows -->
</div>
See full page example

Footer

The footer is versatile and easy to customize, yet simple enough to use out of the box.

It has a built-in top margin so your body content does not run into it.

Wolters Kluwer Logo Only

The tagline is suitable for marketing sites.

Note: Per branding guidelines, do not use the tagline in products or applications.
When you have to be right

Buttons

Several types of buttons are available which include styles for hover, disabled, and loading states.

Additionally, this component provides button bars, which are useful in forms, to align groups of buttons to the left or right.

Button Types

Anchor tag as buttonAnother anchorAnchor tag full button
<div class="wk-button-bar">
  <button>Default</button>
  <button class="wk-button-secondary">Secondary</button>
  <button class="wk-button-success">Success</button>
  <button class="wk-button-danger">Danger</button>
  <button disabled="disabled">Disabled Default</button>
  <button disabled="disabled" class="wk-button-secondary">Disabled Secondary</button>
  <button disabled="disabled" class="wk-button-success">Disabled Success</button>
  <button disabled="disabled" class="wk-button-danger">Disabled Danger</button>
</div>
<div class="wk-button-bar">
  <button class="wk-button-full">Full Button</button>
</div>
<div class="wk-button-bar"><a href="javascript:void(0)" role="button" class="wk-button">Anchor tag as button</a><a href="javascript:void(0)" role="button" class="wk-button wk-button-secondary">Another anchor</a><a href="javascript:void(0)" role="button" class="wk-button wk-button-full">Anchor tag full button</a></div>
<div class="wk-button-bar">
  <button class="wk-button-icon"><span class="wk-icon-bell"></span></button>
  <button class="wk-button-icon"><span class="wk-icon-arrow-thin-right"></span></button>
  <button class="wk-button-icon"><span class="wk-icon-gear"></span></button>
  <button>Plain</button>
</div>

Button Bars

Button bars are a responsive container for buttons that fixes several potential problems to using buttons by their lonesome.

Firstly, button bars manage the margins on buttons on their mobile view.

Secondly, default adjacent buttons may not have whitespace separating them depending on the whitespace in the HTML markup. This inconsistency is handled by using a button bar.

Grouped Left

Grouped Right

Combined Groups

<!-- grouped to the left -->
<div class="wk-button-bar">
  <div class="wk-button-group-left">
    <button>Button One</button>
    <button>Two</button>
    <button>Three</button>
  </div>
</div>
<!-- grouped to the right -->
<div class="wk-button-bar">
  <div class="wk-button-group-right">
    <button>Button Four</button>
    <button>Five</button>
    <button>Six</button>
  </div>
</div>
<!-- two groups in one row -->
<div class="wk-button-bar">
  <div class="wk-button-group-left">
    <button>Button One</button>
    <button>Two</button>
  </div>
  <div class="wk-button-group-right">
    <button>Button Three</button>
    <button>Four</button>
  </div>
</div>

▲ Back to top

Forms & Input

Did you include Modernizr and IE conditional statements? This component requires them!

Field Items

Anatomy of a field:

Field header
contains the <label> and includes a margin to separate the <label> from the input element. It also contains span.wk-field-tip which is for presenting any extra information to the user.
Input element
Either text input, textarea, select, checkbox, or radio, all of which include a margin to separate it from the error region.
Error region
Reserved space for a possible error.
Built-in margin
A bottom margin to separate adjacent fields.
See full page example

Text Input

Something blew up!
<!-- use a placeholder if you like -->
<div class="wk-field-item">
  <div class="wk-field-header">
    <label>Your label here</label>
  </div>
  <input type="text" placeholder="Type something"/>
  <div class="wk-field-error"></div>
</div>
<!-- disabled added to input element  -->
<div class="wk-field-item">
  <div class="wk-field-header">
    <label>Text Input</label>
  </div>
  <input type="text" placeholder="Type something" disabled="disabled"/>
  <div class="wk-field-error"></div>
</div>
<!-- this has an error -->
<div class="wk-field-item wk-field-has-error">
  <div class="wk-field-header">
    <label>Your label here</label>
  </div>
  <input type="text" placeholder="Type something"/>
  <div class="wk-field-error">Required</div>
</div>

Textarea

Textareas come in three sizes and are optionally resizable.

Whoops!
<!-- resizable -->
<div class="wk-field-item">
  <div class="wk-field-header">
    <label>Textarea input</label>
  </div>
  <textarea placeholder="Type something" class="wk-textarea-short"></textarea>
  <div class="wk-field-error"></div>
</div>
<!-- normal state -->
<div class="wk-field-item">
  <div class="wk-field-header">
    <label>Textarea input</label>
  </div>
  <!-- short, medium, or tall class to change the height-->
  <textarea placeholder="Type something" class="wk-textarea-no-resize wk-textarea-short"></textarea>
  <div class="wk-field-error"></div>
</div>
<!-- disabled state -->
<div class="wk-field-item">
  <div class="wk-field-header">
    <label>Textarea</label>
  </div>
  <textarea disabled="disabled" placeholder="Disabled state" class="wk-textarea-no-resize wk-textarea-short"></textarea>
  <div class="wk-field-error"></div>
</div>
<!-- error state -->
<div class="wk-field-item wk-field-has-error">
  <div class="wk-field-header">
    <label>Textarea</label>
  </div>
  <textarea placeholder="Error state" class="wk-textarea-no-resize wk-textarea-short"></textarea>
  <div class="wk-field-error">Whoops!</div>
</div>

Error goes here

    <label>Select with error</label>
  </div>
  <div class="wk-select-field">
    <select>
      <option>First one</option>
      <option>Section choice</option>
      <option>Last but not least, the final option</option>
    </select>
  </div>
  <div class="wk-field-error">Error goes here</div>
</div>

  <div class="wk-field-header">
    <label>Disabled select</label>
  </div>

    <select disabled="disabled">
      <option>First one</option>
      <option>Section choice</option>

    </select>
  </div>
  <div class="wk-field-error"></div>
</div>

▲ Back to top

Tables

For prettier tables simply add .wk-table to a <table>.

Included are styles for sortable columns, <thead> and <tfoot>.

For tables with many columns, .wk-table-permit-overflow allows for horizontal scrolling and prevents a body scrollbar.

This following table’s data is wider than the viewable area so you may scroll horizontally!

Ad ea Do deserunt Esse eiusmod Adipisicing duis elit Et minim anim
Do Lorem Lorem duis Ex magna fugiat Aute est sit Enim id laborum
Culpa minim sint esse aliqua Voluptate ex ipsum esse nostrud Laborum nisi nostrud nisi aute Incididunt est ut et adipisicing Mollit proident excepteur Lorem ipsum
Culpa proident Lorem sit do Anim deserunt nisi in sint Aute eiusmod aute id culpa Officia enim commodo sunt sunt Ipsum amet eiusmod do reprehenderit 
<table class="wk-table">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th class="wk-table-ascent">Voluptate minim 
      </th>
      <th>Cillum dolor 
      </th>
      <th>Adipisicing labore 
      </th>
      <th>Lorem Lorem in 
      </th>
      <th>Do eiusmod adipisicing 
      </th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tfoot>
    <tr>
      <th>Esse culpa 
      </th>
      <th>Duis labore 
      </th>
      <th>Tempor laborum ex 
      </th>
      <th>Dolor sunt est 
      </th>
      <th>Nostrud velit mollit 
      </th>
    </tr>
  </tfoot>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td class="wk-table-sorted">Voluptate aliquip officia quis sit 
      </td>
      <td>Et consequat aute ipsum dolor 
      </td>
      <td>Veniam est deserunt mollit sint 
      </td>
      <td>Anim eiusmod nulla excepteur non 
      </td>
      <td>Deserunt fugiat incididunt occaecat adipisicing 
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td class="wk-table-sorted">Aliquip sit laborum mollit ipsum 
      </td>
      <td>Velit labore nisi consequat fugiat 
      </td>
      <td>Incididunt proident aliqua eu labore 
      </td>
      <td>Magna aliquip quis consectetur occaecat 
      </td>
      <td>Irure et consequat ex ipsum 
      </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
<!-- outer class provides a horiztonal scroll when necessary -->
<div class="wk-table-permit-overflow">
  <table class="wk-table">
    <thead>
      <tr>
        <th>Id do 
        </th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
      <tr>
        <td>Deserunt sit 
        </td>
      </tr>
    </tbody>
  </table>
</div>

▲ Back to top

Alerts

Call attention to a notification with one of three states: info, success, and error.

Info Alert

Labore qui velit veniam labore velit amet. Consectetur excepteur Lorem sunt in occaecat velit incididunt officia.

Success Alert

Nisi ex eiusmod velit amet dolore exercitation. Magna non nisi occaecat dolor non ad.

Danger Alert

Mollit consequat minim in minim ea fugiat duis minim labore magna officia. Dolor quis id est exercitation amet est laboris dolore excepteur ipsum.

Dismissible Alert

Voluptate quis Lorem voluptate irure laborum aute. Dolore aute dolor mollit qui deserunt commodo adipisicing aliquip qui. 
<div class="wk-alert-info">Ullamco velit sit ipsum tempor occaecat proident non dolore. In ut laboris amet labore ut dolor cupidatat aliqua. 
</div>
<div class="wk-alert-success">Duis pariatur mollit est aliqua laboris adipisicing. Ad do deserunt aliqua quis voluptate fugiat. 
</div>
<div class="wk-alert-danger">Sint amet dolor elit qui ipsum quis duis Lorem ut. Pariatur velit mollit commodo et ad quis ex sunt proident pariatur fugiat. 
</div>
<div class="wk-alert-info wk-alert-dismissible">
  <button type="button" class="wk-icon-close-empty"></button>Non occaecat minim esse elit cillum labore voluptate magna. Excepteur do veniam ut proident magna excepteur est. 
</div>

Tooltips

Hover over the link below to see the tooltip.

Now you see me!
Hover me! 

<div class="wk-tooltip wk-position-top">
  <div class="wk-tooltip-body">Now you see me!</div>
</div>

Use .wk-position-[position] class to change the arrow position on the tooltip.

▲ Back to top

Popovers

Add small overlays of content to any element for housing secondary information.

Now you see me!

<div class="wk-popover wk-position-left">
  <div class="wk-popover-body">Now you see me!</div>
</div>

Use .wk-position-[position] class to change the arrow position on the popover

See full page example

▲ Back to top

Modals

Modal windows are suitable for drawing attention to vital pieces of information, blocking the application flow to get required information or to warn the user of the effects of a certain actions.

Markup

Adipisicing et incididunt consectetur laborum

Pariatur occaecat magna sit aute culpa elit nisi esse cillum ex laborum magna cupidatat est esse mollit esse in ut cillum non consequat fugiat ipsum ut sunt incididunt exercitation irure

Sizing

You can achieve different sizes by adding the classes .wk-modal-small , .wk-modal-medium and .wk-modal-large alongside the .wk-modal element.

Overlay

To display a backdrop or overlay, add the class .wk-modal-with-overlay alongside the .wk-modal element.

<div tabindex="-1" role="dialog" class="wk-modal wk-modal-large">
  <section class="wk-modal-content">
    <header class="wk-modal-header">
      <h4 class="wk-modal-title">Laboris eiusmod ad tempor ad 
      </h4>
      <div tabIndex="0" aria-label="close dialog" class="wk-modal-close"><span class="wk-icon-close-empty"></span></div>
    </header>
    <div class="wk-modal-body">
      <p>Magna eiusmod magna proident eiusmod in veniam laboris qui velit dolore magna reprehenderit mollit adipisicing quis aute tempor aute proident culpa cillum eu elit eiusmod magna aute adipisicing sint ipsum 
      </p>
    </div>
    <footer class="wk-modal-footer">
      <div class="wk-button-bar">
        <div class="wk-button-group-right">
          <button class="wk-button-secondary">Cancel</button>
          <button>Accept</button>
        </div>
      </div>
    </footer>
  </section>
</div>
See full page example

▲ Back to top

Labels

Contextual boxes that are suitable for almost any content. Use these to make certain information stand out.

Default Label

Magna incididunt

Info Label

Duis ex

Success Label

Pariatur commodo

Danger Label

Laboris aliquip

Labels with icons

Sometimes you need to add an icon to a label, for example to denote an specific action that can be done by clicking on it. Check the icons section on this page for a full list of available icons.

Just add the wk-icon-[icon-name] class in the same label element.

Proident excepteur 

<span class="wk-label">Officia aute </span>
<span class="wk-label-info">Deserunt sint </span>
<span class="wk-label-success">Exercitation laborum </span>
<span class="wk-label-danger">Laborum consectetur </span>
<span class="wk-label wk-icon-close-outline">Duis consectetur </span>

Make your own label class by supplying a background and text color.

.my-context-label {
    @include wk-label(#0668a9, #fff);
}

▲ Back to top

Badges

Badges are generic inline containers for numerical content. Add them to headings, paragraphs, lists, buttons, anything really!

In Headings

Sunt 73

In Links

Eu irure cupidatat 100

In Paragraphs

Esse veniam incididunt magna nulla ut excepteur est nulla exercitation ut. 9 Esse culpa minim enim reprehenderit ullamco nostrud anim.

In Buttons

In Lists

  • Nulla 1
  • Enim ea 5 
<span class="wk-badge">100</span>

▲ Back to top

Breadcrumbs

Straightforward enough, breadcrumbs can be placed anywhere, but recommended in the breadcrumb bar.

Default

  1. Home
  2. Code Sections
  3. Income Taxes

With Icons

  1. Home
  2. Code Sections
  3. Income Taxes

In Navbar

  1. Home
  2. Code Sections
  3. Income Taxes
<!-- default-->
<div class="wk-breadcrumb-bar">
  <div class="wk-breadcrumb-container">
    <ol class="wk-breadcrumb">
      <li><a href="/"><span>Home</span></a></li>
      <li><a href="/"><span>Code Sections</span></a></li>
      <li><span>Income Taxes</span></li>
    </ol>
  </div>
</div>
<!-- icons-->
<div class="wk-breadcrumb-bar">
  <div class="wk-breadcrumb-container">
    <ol class="wk-breadcrumb">
      <li><a href="/"><span class="wk-icon-home-outline">Home</span></a></li>
      <li><a href="/"><span>Code Sections</span></a></li>
      <li><span>Income Taxes</span></li>
    </ol>
  </div>
</div>
<!-- navbar-->
<nav role="navigation" class="wk-navbar">
  <div class="wk-navbar-container">
    <ol class="wk-breadcrumb">
      <li><a href="/"><span class="wk-icon-home-outline">Home</span></a></li>
      <li><a href="/"><span>Code Sections</span></a></li>
      <li><span>Income Taxes</span></li>
    </ol>
  </div>
</nav>

Pagination

As you might expect, pagination is simply a list of links. It includes styles for the active and hover states.

Standalone

  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • 5

Pagination Bar

  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
<ul class="wk-pagination">
  <li><a tabIndex="0" class="wk-button wk-button-icon"><span class="wk-icon-arrow-left"></span></a></li>
  <li><a tabIndex="0">1</a></li>
  <li class="wk-active"><a tabIndex="0">2</a></li>
  <li><a tabIndex="0">3</a></li>
  <li><a tabIndex="0">4</a></li>
  <li><a tabIndex="0">5</a></li>
  <li><a tabIndex="0" class="wk-button wk-button-icon"><span class="wk-icon-arrow-right"></span></a></li>
</ul>
<div class="wk-pagination-bar">
  <div class="wk-pagination-results">
    <div class="wk-field-item">
      <div class="wk-field-header">
        <label>Results per page</label>
      </div>
      <div class="wk-select-field">
        <select>
          <option>10</option>
          <option>25</option>
          <option>100</option>
        </select>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <ul class="wk-pagination">
    <li class="wk-disabled"><a tabIndex="0" href="javascript:void(0);" class="wk-button wk-button-icon"><span class="wk-icon-arrow-left"></span></a></li>
    <li class="wk-active"><a tabIndex="0" href="javascript:void(0);">1</a></li>
    <li><a tabIndex="0" href="javascript:void(0);">2</a></li>
    <li><a tabIndex="0" href="javascript:void(0);">3</a></li>
    <li><a tabIndex="0" href="javascript:void(0);">4</a></li>
    <li><a tabIndex="0" href="javascript:void(0);" class="wk-button wk-button-icon"><span class="wk-icon-arrow-right"></span></a></li>
  </ul>
</div>

▲ Back to top

Icons

A handpicked collection of monochrome icons available as a web font. It’s easy to change their colors and sizes.

Icons are implemented with <span> tags. Just add a class name.

Default Size + Color

wk-icon-search
wk-icon-alert
wk-icon-angle-down
wk-icon-angle-left
wk-icon-angle-right
wk-icon-angle-up
wk-icon-apps
wk-icon-arrow-back
wk-icon-arrow-down
wk-icon-arrow-forward
wk-icon-arrow-left
wk-icon-arrow-right
See full icon library 
<span class="wk-icon-search"></span>
// color all icons blue 
@include wk-target-icons {
    color: $wk-primary-blue;
}
// make all icons bigger 
@include wk-target-icons {
    font-size: 2rem;
}
Make something spin by adding the .wk-spin class.

▲ Back to top

Document

Just wrap document content with a .wk-document class.

Using older document markup? Maybe you want the document-legacy component. These document examples demonstrate more: basic document, code section, with footnotes.

Cupidatat reprehenderit ex

Ut proident dolore consectetur commodo elit esse cillum ullamco laborum ipsum sint. Dolor mollit elit Anim cupidatat eu et non duis fugiat id ullamco labore Lorem id excepteur. Culpa magna ipsum cupidatat ut in amet sint fugiat ut sint est veniam. Ut qui proident aliquip occaecat voluptate labore id sint adipisicing voluptate incididunt et deserunt quis. 

<div class="wk-document">
  <h3 class="wk-h3">Culpa id deserunt 
  </h3>
  <p>Do ut ad officia laborum cupidatat est. <a href="#" title="test link"> Sint ea cupidatat </a>Nulla adipisicing cupidatat sit amet quis laboris. Esse in occaecat irure culpa Lorem eu reprehenderit. Aliqua excepteur aliqua nostrud laboris ea veniam. 
  </p>
</div>
See full page example

▲ Back to top

Toolbelt

.wk-clearfix
Force a clear:both;. You shouldn’t need this with layout or button bar components, they include their own float clearing.
.wk-hide-text
Hides text.
.wk-text-overflow
Hide overflowed text by adding an ellipsis.
.wk-shown
Shows an element by using display: block;.
.wk-hidden
Hide an element by using display: none;.
.wk-logo-small
Hides Wolters Kluwer logo on large screens by using .wk-hidden.
.wk-logo-large
Hides Wolters Kluwer logo on small screens and shows on large screens by using .wk-hidden & .wk-shown.

▲ Back to top
